intro: Silene vulgaris subsp. commutata, commonly known as redstem sandwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers in dense clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. This subspecies is often found in open habitats such as dunes, prairies, and disturbed areas.
